body: We've also been hitting this with 6.4.0

I thought this was related to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/d6c79dbde3365c2e0e370eba4942ea49e3533395 but it's more likely to be unrelated. Could you please try to reproduce with Bazel head?
@keertk When was 7.0 cut? I thought it would be after the 13th of October, is https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/d6c79dbde3365c2e0e370eba4942ea49e3533395 in 7.0?
I'm more convinced now that this is a separate bug not fixed by that PR but I will need to investigate further.

issue.title: [7.0.0] "I/O exception during sandboxed execution" "Directory not empty" with `--experimental_reuse_sandbox_directories`

milestone.title: 7.0.0 release blockers

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.title: [7.0.0] "I/O exception during sandboxed execution" "Directory not empty" with `--experimental_reuse_sandbox_directories`

labels.name: team-Local-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
#19935 gives a clear repro. The problem appears when a stashed sandbox
contains a directory whose same path is a regular file in a later
execution. If we try to reuse the stashed sandbox we trigger an error if
the old directory contained any files.

This was due to simply calling delete() without checking first if it
was a directory. The fix is to call deleteTree() instead in those cases.
directory.

Fixes #19935
